Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct ?
options: Sounds wave in gases are longitudinal in nature
Sounds wave having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves
Sounds waves having higher amplitudes are louder
Sound waves with high audible frequencies are sharp
Physics (Waves & Sound).answer: Sounds wave having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: The sound waves having frequency below 20 Hz are inaudible. Ultrasonic waves are those waves which have the frequency of above 20,000 Hz.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: A person rings a metallic bell near a strong concrete wall. He hears the echo after 0.3 s. if the sound moves with a speed of 340 m/s, how far is the wall from him?
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: Let the distance is x metre. Distance = Velocity × Time. x = 340 × 0.3 = 102 metre (This is the total distance). \ The distance of wall is 102/2 = 51 metre.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: A myopic person has a power of 1.25 dioptre, what is the focal length and nature of his lens ?
Physics (Optics).explanation: The nature of the lens used to correct myopic eye is a concave lens. \ D = 1/f(metre) = 1/D = 1/1.25 = 100/125 = 0.80 metre = 80 cm

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Which one of the following statements about bar magnet is correct ?
options: The pole strength of the north-pole of a bar magnet is larger than that of the south-pole
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis, the north and south pole get separated
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis two new bar magnets are formed
The poles of a bar magnet are unequal in magnitude and opposite in nature
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).answer: When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis two new bar magnets are formed
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: If any magnet is divided into two parts, every part will be a new magnet.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The rate of change of momentum of a body equal of the resultant :
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Newton's 2nd Law - The rate of Change of momentum always acts in the direction of resultant force acting on a body Þ (F = ma) (where m = mass; a = aceeleration)

Physics (Units & Dimensions).subject: Physics (Units & Dimensions)
Physics (Units & Dimensions).question: The SI unit of mechanical power is :
Physics (Units & Dimensions).explanation: Watt is the SI unit of mechanical power.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: Plants contain a variety of sterols like stigmasterol, ergosterol, sitosterol etc. which very closely resemble cholesterol. These plant sterols are referred as:
Biochemistry.explanation: Phytosterols (plant sterols) are a family of molecules related to cholesterol. Structurally, these are very similar to cholesterol except that they always contain some substitutions at the C24 position on the sterol side chain.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: Vitamin B12 deficiency causes pernicious anemia, Animals cannot synthesize vitamin B12. Humans must obtain all their vitamin B12 from their diet. The complexing metal ion in vitamin B12 is :
Biochemistry.explanation: Cobalt is the active centre of coenzymes called cobalamins, the most common example of which is vitamin B12.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: Glucose is a source of energy. Which one of the following types of molecule is glucose ?
Biochemistry.explanation: Glucose is a sugar with the molecular formula C6H12O6. The suffix "-ose" is a chemical classifier, denoting a Carbohydrate.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: Which one of the following hormones contains peptide chain ?
Biochemistry.explanation: Insulin is a peptide hormone produced by beta cells in the pancreas and by Brockmann body in some teleost fish.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: In artificial insemination (AI) process. Which of the following is/are introduced into the uterus of the female ?
Human Physiology.explanation: The Artificial Insemination (AI) is the process in which a thin, flexible tube (Catheter) is used to put sperm artificially into a woman's cervix.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question:
Genetically modified (GM) crops contain modified genetic material due to :
1. introduction of new DNA
2. removal of existing DNA
3. introduction of RNA
4. introduction of new traits
Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Genetics.explanation: Introduction of new traits to the plant which does not occur naturally in the species introduction of new DNA and removal of existing DNA are the processes by which Genetically Modified crops are produced.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question:
The Germplasm is required for the propagation of plants and animals, Germplasm is the :
1. genetic resources
2. seeds or tissues for breeding
3. egg and sperm repository
4. a germ cell's determining zone
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Genetics.explanation: Germplasm is a biosubstance (eg. - seeds, tissue pollen grains, sperms & eggs etc.) which is used as genetic material for animal & plant breeding for preservation and research purpose.

Nutrition.subject: Nutrition
Nutrition.question: Which one of the following vitamins has a role in blood clotting ?
Nutrition.explanation: Vitamin K is essential for the functioning of several proteins involved in physiological processes that encompass, but are not limited to, the regulation of blood clotting.

Nutrition.subject: Nutrition
Nutrition.question:
Which of the following pairs of vitamin and disease is / are correctly matched ?
1. Vitamin A - Rickets
2. Vitamin B1 - Beribri
3. Vitamin C - Scurvy
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Nutrition.explanation:
Vitamin A - Night blindness
Vitamin B1 - Beriberi
Vitamin C - Scurvy

Cell Biology.subject: Cell Biology
Cell Biology.question: The living content of cell is called protoplasm. It is composed of :
Cell Biology.explanation: Protoplasm is the whole content of a cell enclosed within the cell membrane, including both the cytoplasm and nucleus.

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: Which one of the following is considered as 'good cholesterol' with reference to individuals facing the risk of cardio-vascular diseases and hypertension?
Health and Disease.explanation: Good Cholesterol refers to HDL (High Density Lipoprotein), Lipoproteins are complex particles composed of multiple type of proteins.

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question:
Dengue virus is known to cause low platelet count in blood of patient by :
1. interfering in the process of platelet production in bone marrow
2. infecting endothelial cells
3. binding with platelets
4. accumulating platelets in intestine
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Health and Disease.explanation: Dengue virus after infection, interferes the production of platelets in bone marrow, infects endothelial cells and bind with platelets.
